citation.article-title: Rheinheimera soli sp. nov., a gammaproteobacterium isolated from soil in Korea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Rheinheimera soli sp. nov.
Rheinheimera soli (so′li. L. fem. gen. n. soli of soil, the source of the type strain).
Colonies are white, raised and circular with entire margins after 3 days on R2A agar.
Cells are facultatively aerobic, Gram-negative, straight or curved rods that are motile by means of a polar flagellum.
Optimal growth occurs at 25–30 °C and pH 7.0–7.5.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite, but nitrogen gas is not produced.
Casein, urea, tyrosine, Tweens 80 and 20, aesculin, starch and gelatin are hydrolysed.
Produces acid from raffinose, myo-inositol, lactose, l-arabinose, melibiose, d-fructose, salicin and arbutin, but not from d-mannose, d-galactose or d-mannitol.
Negative for indole production, glucose fermentation and arginine dihydrolase activity.

Positive for assimilation of d-glucose, l-arabinose, N-acetylglucosamine and maltose, but negative for assimilation of d-mannose, d-mannitol, potassium gluconate, capric acid, adipic acid, malic acid, trisodium citrate and phenylacetic acid (API 20NE).

Produces alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, but not lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase or α-fucosidase.
Weak enzyme activities are observed for acid phosphatase, α-galactosidase and α-glucosidase.
Contains large amounts of phosphatidylethanolamine and phosphatidylglycerol, and small amounts of an unknown polar lipid and three unknown polar lipids containing amino groups.
The isoprenoid quinones are Q-8 (75 %) and MK-7 (25 %).
The major cellular fatty acids are summed feature 3 (C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH), C12 : 0 3-OH and C16 : 0.
The DNA G+C content is 49.2 mol% (HPLC).
The type strain, BD-d46T (=KCTC 22077T =DSM 19413T), was isolated from playground soil in Jinju, South Korea.
